message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with online learning algorithms, which are commonly studied in the machine learning community. The use of an approximation oracle is a common technique in optimization, which suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the optimization community. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). The paper also discusses the use of information theory and signal processing techniques, which may make cs.IT (Information Theory) a relevant sub-category. Finally, the paper's focus on online learning and bandit algorithms suggests that cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) may also be a relevant sub-category.
